author: Dan Wandera
title: Luweero Christians sue 37 CoU bishops | Monitor
text: Prime Luweero Christians sue 37 CoU bishops What you need to know: - The Christians accuse the bishops of being unfair to Rev Godfrey Kasana, whose election was nullified over infedility allegations. Dissatisfied by a court ruling that reaffirmed the powers of the Church in the election and consecration process of a bishop under the Church of Uganda, four Christians have petitioned the court targeting individual bishops. The High Court in Luweero District has now summoned 37 bishops who reportedly constituted the House of Bishops’ meeting at Kabalega Resort in Hoima District on June 28, which nullified the election of Rev Godfrey Kasana as bishop of Luweero. In a civil suit filed before the Assistant Court Registrar Kenneth Tumwebaze on December 6, the petitioners have placed fresh demands requiring individual bishops to file their respective defence within 15 days from the date of service of the court summons. “You are hereby requested to file a defence in the said suit within 15 days from date of service. Should you fail to defend yourself within the date mentioned, the plaintiff may proceed with the suit and judgment may be given in your absence,” read in part, the court summons to the respective 37 bishops, signed by Mr Tumwebaze. The four petitioners are Moses Bemba, Moses Kakembo, John Saight Ssendowoza and Christopher Sajjabi Katende. The bishops are accused of failure to accord Bishop Kasana a fair hearing on accusations raised against him. The Christians ,among others, want court to halt the ongoing process for nomination and election of the fourth bishop of Luweero Diocese. They also want court to declare Rev Can Kasana as the duly elected fourth bishop of Luweero Diocese to pave the way for his consecration ceremony. They accuse the 37 bishops of failing to accord Rev Kasana a fair hearing and failing to adduce evidence about the allegations of infidelity. The demands by the four Christians are not different from those raised in the earlier case where the High Court ruled in favour of the Church and Archbishop Samuel Kaziimba Mugalu in October 2023. But Mr Erasto Kibirango, the lawyer of the aggrieved Christians, told publication yesterday that unlike the other case earlier filed against the archbishop, the new case deals with the individual participation of the respective bishops in alleged violation of the basic human rights of Rev Can Kasana when they failed to accord him a fair hearing. “Unlike the first case where the High Court gave its ruling, this case is not about the faith matters but the violation of the Constitutional basic human rights of Rev Godfrey Kasana for a fair hearing. We are even serving two of the bishops who recently retired but were members of the House of Bishops by July 2023,” he said. The Christians, through M/S Kibirango & Partners Advocates, said the process of serving the individual bishops at their respective dioceses was ongoing. Those sued The 37 bishops include retired bishops Eridard Nsubuga of Luweero and Wilberforce Kityo Luwalira of Namirembe Dioceses, Michael Lubowa (Central Buganda), Sheldon Mwesigwa (Ankole), Samuel Egesa Bogere (Bukedi), Samuel Kahuma (Bunyoro Kitara), Paul Samson Naimanhe (Busoga), Patrick Wakula (Central Busoga), Gaddie Akanjuna (Kigezi), Dan Zoreka (Kinkizi), Prof Alfred Olwa (Lango), Cranimer Mugisha (Muhabura), Reuben Kisembo (Rwenzori), Joseph Abura (Karamoja), Wilson Kitara (Kitgum), Michael Okwi Esakhan(Kumi), Charles Andaku (Madi and West Nile), George Kasangaki (Masindi), Wilson Nandaah (Mbale), Dr James Bukomeko (Mityana) Enos Kagodo (Mukono), Ozelle Awinjo (Nebbi), Stephen Namanya (North Ankole), James Nasak (North Karamoja), Patrick Tugume (North Kigezi), Samuel Gidudu (North Mbale), Godfrey Loum (Northern Uganda), Amos Magezi (West Ankole), Paul Kaptoo Masaba (Nebbi), Hosea Odongo (Soroti), Nathan Ahimbisibwe (South Ankole), Nason Baruku (South Rwenzori), Johnson Twinomujuni (West Ankole), Henry Katumba (West Buganda), Julius Caesar Niina Otim (West Lango) and the Bishop of East Rwenzori George K Turyasingura.

author: Ricardo Sánchez Rico
title: Al menos diez detenidos en una operación antidroga de la Policía Nacional
text:
Palencia
Al menos diez detenidos en una operación antidroga de la Policía NacionalSecciones
Servicios
Palencia
Al menos diez detenidos en una operación antidroga de la Policía NacionalLa Policía Nacional, en una operación antidroga llevada a cabo durante la madrugada de este miércoles en diferentes puntos de la capital palentina, ha procedido ... a la detención de al menos diez personas, varias de ellas musulmanas.
El fuerte despliegue policial de la Comisaría Provincial de Palencia, en el que han tomado parte también efectivos de la Unidad de Intervención Policial (UIP) de Valladolid, ha despertado la expectación de los palentinos que, como en el caso del Sector 8, transitaban a primera hora de la mañana por las calles Lola de la Fuente y Marcos de Celis y que se han topado con ese amplio dispositivo de agentes.
En esa zona de la capital palentina se han llevado a cabo registros domiciliarios, lo mismo que en otras como el barrio del Carmen o la avenida de Asturias, hasta completar al menos los agentes intervinientes en la operación hasta nueve entradas en viviendas.
Aunque no ha trascendido ninguna información oficial al respecto, la operación policial contra el tráfico de drogas se ha saldado hasta el momento con al menos diez personas detenidas.

author: El Heraldo
title: Atlántico se proyecta con mayor inversión para energías limpias en Colombia
text: El Atlántico sería el segundo departamento que mayor inversión recibirá en materia de energías renovables en Colombia durante el 2024 y 2025. Así lo indicó la encuesta realizada por la Asociación de Energías Renovables (SER), la cual señala que cuenta con una capacidad instalada de 974 megavatios que permitiría generar el consumo del 70 % de la población.Este anuncio se dio tras una reunión entre la Gobernación del Atlántico, alcaldías municipales, la Corporación Autónoma Regional (CRA) y Barranquilla Verde, donde se confirmó que, con la llegada de estos 10 proyectos ubicados en los municipios de Galapa, Malambo, Baranoa, Sabanalarga y Barranquilla representaría inversiones por el orden de los 700 y 900 millones de dólares.Ante esto, el gobernador Eduardo Verano indicó que estos proyectos identificados en empresas como Enel, Canadian Recurrent, Viridi, Grenergy, Verano Energy, Solgtec, Solarpak, SER Colombia, entre otras, generarían hasta 974 megavatios en proyectos que podrían convertir al Atlántico en un departamento que puede tener la más grande construcción de proyectos de carácter de energías renovables.“Eso nos haría un departamento supremamente atractivo y es precisamente por la facilidad que se tiene a nivel de infraestructura y la actitud que tiene nuestro departamento para que se desarrollen toda esta clase de proyectos. Esto es muy importante para el futuro del Atlántico”, expresó Verano.Por su parte, Cecilia Arango, secretaria de Planeación Departamental, manifestó que en el Plan de Desarrollo hay un enfoque en sostenibilidad que apunta a las energías renovables y el apoyo institucional que desde la Gobernación se pueda ofrecer a todas las firmas inversionistas que deseen apostar por la creación de proyectos. “Es fundamental lograr esa competitividad sostenible que nos va a ayudar a vendernos como territorio para hacerlo más atractivo y traer así mayor inversión y mejorar la economía de toda nuestra gente”, aseveró.La funcionaria también afirmó que el compromiso actual está basado en articularnos institucionalmente y “buscar que la Gobernación sea ese vehículo que facilita para que todos estos inversionistas puedan entrar mucho más rápido con sus proyectos y puedan beneficiar a todas las comunidades, esa es la tarea que nos hemos impuesto y vamos a trabajar para ello”.A su turno, el alcalde de Baranoa, Edinson Palma, comentó que actualmente en el municipio están desarrollándose tres proyectos de energías limpias donde tienen proyectado producir dentro del territorio para ser comercializado.“Hemos manifestado nuestro apoyo y acompañamiento institucional a este proyecto que si bien es cierto, va a contribuir a combatir el cambio climático, fortalecerá el medio ambiente y entrará a mejorar todo el desarrollo económico de Baranoa, la generación de empleo para nuestra gente, la mano de obra no calificada y calificada y las inversiones que se hacen allí que sin duda alguna va a mejorar al municipio”, comentó Palma.Asimismo, Alexandra Hernández, directora de SER Colombia, expuso que esta es una oportunidad para el Atlántico y que lo convierte en el segundo departamento con mayor capacidad esperada en este 2024 y que tendría una capacidad con conexiones aprobadas por la UPME a 2032 que alcanza los 1.444 megavatios. “Esto significa que el impacto que generaríamos sería en todo el territorio y se atendería el consumo del 70 % de la población del departamento del Atlántico. Esto lo convierte en un hito muy importante para la Región y para el país”, puntualizó.

author: @hercampus
title: WHY I BELIEVE IN MANIFESTATION
text:
Have you ever caught the clock at 11:11 and squeezed your eyes shut to make a wish? Or filled your heart with desires upon seeing the fleeting gleam of a shooting star? Or gently blown away a fallen eyelash while holding the warmth of hope in your mind? These wishful traditions and legends may seem naive at times, but I like to believe that visualization and optimistic practices have bettered my life.
Manifestation, the practice of bringing a particular goal into reality through focused thoughts and intentions, has gained popularity in recent years. Especially on social media platforms, like TikTok, videos about spirituality and astrology have captured the attention of curious individuals. The theory of manifestation is often connected to the law of attraction, a universal philosophy that suggests that positive thinking attracts positive experiences.
I embrace manifestation — not in the sense of passive thinking but in the sense of proactive alignment. In my everyday life, manifestation is a tool that I use to center my thoughts, emotions, and actions toward my ambitions. By channeling my energy toward more forward-looking and targeted pursuits, I have discovered the power that a confident mindset holds. Manifestation is not based on merely wishing for change. It’s based on actively working towards change and, most importantly, truly believing that change will occur.
I find comfort in the simple superstitions of wishing wells and wishbones because they help me reflect on my dreams in a seemingly magical way. The act of wishing provides me with a sense of control and optimism in the face of adversity. This mindfulness empowers me to persevere through obstacles and appreciate my small victories.
While manifestation is regarded as a pseudoscience, I can attest to the power of positive thinking in guiding my life. So, as you navigate the ups and downs of your life, try to remember that your wishes can hold potential if you allow them to. The next time that you catch sight of the clock at 11:11 or witness a shooting star while stargazing, give it a chance and embrace the possibility of magic.

author: world today news
title: The Pumas 7s misplaced, a participant apologized for the yellow card and a heated match is coming
text:
Escuchar
PARIS (particular correspondent).- The conflict of planets is coming within the rugby sevens of the Olympic Video games: Argentina-France, “the match of morbidity” that will probably be performed within the unimaginable environment supplied by the Stade de France. After the thunderous boos, After the Pumas had been labeled as “public enemies No. 1” Ranging from the primary day because of very contemporary soccer rivalries, each groups will play the quarter-finals immediately at 4:30 p.m. in our nation. All or nothing. Whoever wins will battle for a medal. Whoever loses, goodbye to the hope of a podium in Paris 2024.
Why will they face one another? The Pumas 7s had been unable to take care of the great kind they’d proven within the first spherical and fell to Australia by 22 to 14, a defeat that left them in second place in Group B. On this manner, the staff led by Santiago Gómez Cora, who had already certified for the quarterfinals, will play this spherical in opposition to none aside from the locals, who as a result of fall in opposition to Fiji (12-19) completed second in Group C.
The match in opposition to France will probably be heated, given the hostile local weather of the native followers in the direction of the Argentines. The precedent is the Grand Closing in Madrid, initially of June, the place there have been a number of moments of preventing between the gamers, one thing that altered the environment, and which ended with the sanction of Rodrigo Isgró. There are various causes to think about that the assembly will probably be a cauldron. With a house crowd decided to create a hellish environment for Argentina, and logically ready to cheer on Les Bleus, who’ve been enjoying erratically. A match to not be missed, after the scandal that was unleashed with the nationwide soccer staff in opposition to Morocco in St. Etienne. And it’s clear: the booing will probably be at its peak when Santiago Gómez Cora’s staff seems on the pitch.
The primary match was in 1997 in Punta del Este and France gained 26-0. Since then, they’ve performed 86 rugby sevens matches, with 50 wins for Argentina, 34 for the French and a pair of attracts. The final match was within the decisive match of the Grand Closing in Madrid, and the French staff gained 19-5. Earlier than that match, Los Pumas 7’s had gained 5 consecutive matches.
Argentina took the sphere to sustained booing, a trademark of those Olympic Video games. The massive information was the return to the beginning lineup of Marcos Moneta, the very best offensive participant for Santiago Gómez Cora’s staff, who has recovered from a long-term harm. Argentina had Pellandini, Elizalde, Schulz, Alvarez, Osadczsuk, Luciano González and Moneta within the beginning lineup.
Argentina couldn’t overcome AustraliaSantiago Filipuzzi/Particular Envoy
After two minutes, Luciano González confirmed his nice qualities: energy and the power to cease and begin. He captured a ball, superior with these weapons and left Germán Schulz to dive in for the attempt.
With a minute and a half to go in a interval managed by Argentina, a protracted Australian kick led to a controversial motion that needed to be reviewed by the TMO: Luciano González prevented the quantity 12 from reaching the attempt. He did stop it, sure, however at a excessive price. The infringement price him a yellow card. To high it off, within the subsequent motion, Australia reached the attempt by Hutchison. And ultimately, the Oceania staff struck once more. They gained the exit at altitude and Dowling’s escape resulted in one other conquest. It was two deadly minutes for the Pumas 7s, who went from being forward on the scoreboard to being down (7-10) and with one much less participant.
Álvarez and Schulz, pure defenseSantiago Filipuzzi/Particular Envoy
Within the second half, Argentina continued to be out of focus. Marcos Moneta was unable to comprise Roache, who, with sheer energy and some tumbles, managed to attain a attempt, which was reviewed by the referees.
With three and a half minutes left, Luciano González as soon as once more gained floor with sheer energy and Osadczuk emerged from the ruck to shut the hole and get to inside a degree because of Pellandini’s effectivity within the conversion (which Australia didn’t have, having missed all three tries).
Malouf was superfluous on the appropriate wing in a state of affairs of Argentine defensive disarray and scored Australia’s fourth attempt, which Roache transformed this time to make the rating 22-14.
Australia completed first with 9 factors, adopted by Argentina with 7 factors. Samoa completed subsequent with 5 factors, after beating Kenya 26-0, and had been left ready to undergo as the very best third-placed staff.
Luciano González was the protagonist of the play that marked the turning level within the match. It’s recognized that in rugby sevens, a yellow card can change all the pieces: “The referees determined one thing… I feel it was a mistake on my half. I used to be a bit distracted, I used to be a bit hit, I used to be not ready. I’ve to apologize to my staff as a result of The yellow card is a scarcity of respect for them and for the Argentine public. Now, let’s placed on our greatest face, as a result of the quarter-finals are developing quickly.”
Luciano González, in motion in opposition to AustraliaSantiago Filipuzzi/Particular Envoy
The participant who began on the Membership Social de La Rioja commented on the state of affairs that led to his warning shortly earlier than the top of the primary half: “On the time of the play, it was a matter of operating him again or saving the attempt or not. Sadly, the referees took it the improper manner. It wasn’t like that, I by no means imagined or had the intention of committing a yellow card or a penalty.” González referred to the best way his coronary heart was beating at that second: “Adrenaline makes you suppose that they’ll’t rating a attempt. It’s an important match so that you don’t give it some thought. It comes from inside, instinctively. It wasn’t in the hunt for a penalty and positively not in a malicious manner. It was unhealthy luck. Apologies to everybody and now a clear slate.”
Santiago Gómez Cora, coach of Los Pumas, within the match in opposition to Australia Santiago Filipuzzi/Particular Envoy
Though coach Santiago Gómez Cora didn’t need to initially seek advice from the refereeing by the British participant Adam Leal, ultimately he did: “Taking part in with one much less participant is rather a lot. Subsequently, the choice to use a yellow card have to be 100% protected, as a result of it modifications the story of the match: we have now skilled this all 12 months within the matches we have now misplaced. Typically they’re infractions, generally not. This is similar referee with whom we misplaced 4 of the six defeats. But when we enhance our aerial play, the referee has no instruments to name in opposition to us.”
With out drama, however at all times vital, Gómez Cora commented: “Within the ultimate in Madrid, the pinnacle referee acknowledged to me that this referee was improper. Within the state of affairs with Luciano González there was no sort out and within the final one, the Australian participant didn’t come out. The day I retire I’ll get into arbitration as a result of there’s a lot to appropriate. However now, as a coach, when it comes to the sport, we have now to be extra impeccable in terms of enjoying.”
Conocé The Belief Undertaking

author: CNN Newsource
title: ‘Grandma Dixie’ released from hospital weeks after Greenfield tornado
text:
‘Grandma Dixie’ released from hospital weeks after Greenfield tornado
By Pepper Purpura
Click here for updates on this story
DES MOINES, Iowa (
KCCI) — Dixie Dingman, known as Grandma Dixie, was released from Iowa Methodist Medical Center Tuesday after an EF-4 tornado in Greenfield broke her back, 10 ribs, and destroyed her home.
Dingman narrowly escaped death when the tornado hit her home directly on May 21 with her inside. She was buried alive under the rubble of her home before being transported to a local hospital, then Iowa Methodist in Des Moines.
The 79-year-old woman spent a week in the ICU, underwent multiple surgeries, and is now recuperating in physical therapy. She credits her recovery to a healthy habit she kept up before the storm hit her home, walking 6 miles daily.
Dingman is now living with one of her daughters to continue healing.
Please note: This content carries a strict local market embargo. If you share the same market as the contributor of this article, you may not use it on any platform.
